ul.li1: 1Who is this, coming from Edom,
ul.li2: from Bozrah in bright red garments?
ul.li1: Who is this honored in his garment,
ul.li2: lying down in his great strength?
ul.li1: “It is I, speaking in justice,
ul.li2: mightyLiterally “great” to save!”
ul.li1: 2Why are your garmentsHebrew “garment” red,
ul.li2: and your garments like he who treads in the winepress?
ul.li1: 3“I have trodden the winepress alone,
ul.li2: and there was no man from the peoples with me.
ul.li1: And I trod them in my anger,
ul.li2: and I trampled them in my wrath,
ul.li1: and spattered their juice on my garments,
ul.li2: and stained all my clothing,
ul.li1: 4for the day of vengeance was in my heart,
ul.li2: and the year of my blood-vengeance has come!
ul.li1: 5And I looked, butOr “and” there was no helper,
ul.li2: and I was appalled, butOr “and” there was no one who sustains,
ul.li1: soOr “and” my arm came to assist me,
ul.li2: and my wrath was whatLiterally “it” sustained me.
ul.li1: 6And I trampled peoples in my anger,
ul.li2: and I made them drunk in my wrath,
ul.li3: and I brought their juice down to the earth.”

ul.li1: 7I will mention the loyal love of Yahweh, the praises of Yahweh, according to all that Yahweh has done for us,
ul.li2: and the greatness of goodness to the house of Israel that he has done to them according to his mercy and the abundance of his loyal love.

chapter.p: 8And he said, “Surely my people are children; they will not break faith.” And he became a Savior to them.

ul.li1: 9In all their distress, there was no distress,The reading tradition (Qere) has “he had distress”
ul.li2: and the messenger of his presenceLiterally “face” saved them,
in his love and compassion he himself redeemed them,
ul.li1: and he lifted them up,
ul.li2: and he supported them all the days of old.
ul.li1: 10ButOr “And” they were the ones whoLiterally “they” rebelled,
ul.li2: and they grieved his Holy Spirit,Literally “the spirit of his holiness”
ul.li1: soOr “and” he became an enemy to them;Literally “was changed to them to one who is hostile”
ul.li2: he himself fought against them.
ul.li1: 11ThenOr “And” his people remembered the days of old, of Moses.
ul.li2: Where is the one who led up them from the sea with the shepherds of his flock?
ul.li1: Where is the one who puts his Holy SpiritLiterally “the spirit of his holiness” inside him,
ul.li2: 12who madeLiterally “bringing” his magnificent arm move atLiterally “to” the right hand of Moses,
ul.li1: who dividedLiterally “dividing” the waters before them,Literally “from their face”
ul.li2: to make an everlasting name for himself,
ul.li1: 13who ledLiterally “leading” them through the depths?
ul.li2: They did not stumble like a horse in the desert;
ul.li1: 14like cattle in the valley that goes down, the Spirit of Yahweh gave him rest,Literally “caused to rest”
ul.li2: so you lead your people to make a magnificent name for yourself.

ul.li1: 15Look from heaven,
ul.li2: and see from the lofty residence of your holiness and glory.
ul.li1: Where are your zeal and strength?
ul.li2: Your compassionLiterally “The agitation of your intestines” and mercy to me hold themselves back.
ul.li1: 16For you are our father, although Abraham does not know us,
ul.li2: and Israel does not acknowledge us.
ul.li1: You, Yahweh are our father,
ul.li2: Our Redeemer from of old is your name.
ul.li1: 17Why do you make us wander, Yahweh?
ul.li2: You harden our heart from your ways so that we do not fearLiterally “from the fear of” you.
ul.li1: Turn back for the sake of your servants,
ul.li2: the tribes of your inheritance.
ul.li1: 18Your holy peopleLiterally “The people of your holiness” took possession for a little while;
ul.li2: our adversaries have trampled down your sanctuary.
ul.li1: 19We have been since antiquity; you did not rule them;
ul.li2: they were not called by your name.Literally “your name was not called over them”
